oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Correspondence from Staff Sergeant John K. Orr about horse carvings
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Correspondence from the Nashville Chamber of Commerce, forwarding a request from Staff Sergeant John K. Orr to help him locate "a very interesting handicraft store" he visited in 1938. The Chamber of Commerce forwarded the letter to the Lookout Shop with a note. See item 44176 for a further letter from Sgt. Orr, where he replies to Margaret and inquires about ordering more colt statues from the shop.

Margaret Croft owned part of the Lookout Shop and was involved in its day-to-day business affairs until she sold her shares in 1945. The shop was opened by Arlene Ziegler and Mable Ward in 1939 as a store featuring arts and crafts from Southern artists. The pair sold the shop when they retired in 1953. Ward and Ziegler were also the founders of Nashville's iconic Satsuma Tea Room, which was open from 1918-2001.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Orr, John K.; Nashville Chamber of Commerce
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Woodwork; Wood-carving; Handicraft--United States--History--20th century; Stores, Retail--Tennessee; Craft shops
